property.name: bsp.master.address
property.description: The address of the bsp master server. Either the literal string "local" or a host[:port] (where host is a name or IP address) for distributed mode.

property.name: bsp.master.port
property.description: The port master should bind to.

property.name: bsp.peer.port
property.description: The port an groom server binds to.

property.name: bsp.groom.rpc.port
property.description: The port an groom rpc binds to.

property.name: bsp.http.infoserver.port
property.description: The port where the web-interface can be seen.

property.name: bsp.http.groomserver.port
property.description: The port where the web-interface can be seen.

property.name: bsp.groom.report.address
property.description: The interface and port that groom server listens on. Since it is only connected to by the tasks, it uses the local interface. EXPERT ONLY. Should only be changed if your host does not have the loopback interface.

property.name: bsp.groomserver.pingperiod
property.description: Periodicity in milliseconds that every BSP task should send its hearbeat ping latest. If a task fails to do so, the groom server would deem the task as failed.

property.name: bsp.system.dir
property.description: The shared directory where BSP stores control files.

property.name: bsp.local.dir
property.description: local directory for temporal store.

property.name: hama.tmp.dir
property.description: Temporary directory on the local filesystem.

property.name: bsp.disk.queue.dir
property.description: Temporary directory on the local message buffer on disk.

property.name: bsp.child.java.opts
property.description: Java opts for the groom server child processes. The following symbol, if present, will be interpolated: @taskid@ is replaced by current TaskID. Any other occurrences of '@' will go unchanged. For example, to enable verbose gc logging to a file named for the taskid in /tmp and to set the heap maximum to be a gigabyte, pass a 'value' of: -Xmx1024m -verbose:gc -Xloggc:/tmp/@taskid@.gc The configuration variable bsp.child.ulimit can be used to control the maximum virtual memory of the child processes.

property.name: hama.messenger.compression.class
property.description: The message compression algorithm to choose.

property.name: bsp.local.tasks.maximum
property.description: Number of tasks that run in parallel when in local mode.

property.name: bsp.tasks.maximum
property.description: The maximum number of BSP tasks that will be run simultaneously by a groom server.

property.name: bsp.checkpoint.enabled
property.description: Enable Hama to checkpoint the messages transferred among BSP tasks during the BSP synchronization period.

property.name: bsp.checkpoint.interval
property.description: If bsp.checkpoint.enabled is set to true, the checkpointing is initiated on the valueth synchronization process of BSP tasks.

property.name: hama.zookeeper.property.initLimit
property.description: Property from ZooKeeper's config zoo.cfg. The number of ticks that the initial synchronization phase can take.

property.name: hama.zookeeper.property.syncLimit
property.description: Property from ZooKeeper's config zoo.cfg. The number of ticks that can pass between sending a request and getting an acknowledgment.

property.name: hama.zookeeper.property.dataDir
property.description: Property from ZooKeeper's config zoo.cfg. The directory where the snapshot is stored.

property.name: hama.zookeeper.property.clientPort
property.description: Property from ZooKeeper's config zoo.cfg. The port at which the clients will connect.

property.name: hama.zookeeper.property.maxClientCnxns
property.description: Property from ZooKeeper's config zoo.cfg. Limit on number of concurrent connections (at the socket level) that a single client, identified by IP address, may make to a single member of the ZooKeeper ensemble. Set high to avoid zk connection issues running standalone and pseudo-distributed.

property.name: hama.zookeeper.quorum
property.description: Comma separated list of servers in the ZooKeeper quorum. For example, "host1.mydomain.com,host2.mydomain.com,host3.mydomain.com". By default this is set to localhost for local and pseudo-distributed modes of operation. For a fully-distributed setup, this should be set to a full list of ZooKeeper quorum servers. If HAMA_MANAGES_ZK is set in hama-env.sh this is the list of servers which we will start/stop ZooKeeper on.
